io.github.syst3ms.skriptparser.registration

Class SkriptAddon

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.syst3ms.skriptparser.registration.SkriptAddon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Skript

    public abstract class SkriptAddon
extends java.lang.Object
    The base for all addons, modules that hook into the API to register syntax and handle triggers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SkriptAddon() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canHandleEvent(SkriptEvent event)
      Checks to see whether the given event has been registered by this SkriptAddon ; a basic way to filter out triggers you aren't able to deal with in handleTrigger(Trigger).
      void finishedLoading()
      Is called when a script has finished loading.
      static java.util.List<SkriptAddon> getAddons() 
      abstract void handleTrigger(Trigger trigger)
      When a Trigger is successfully parsed, it is "broadcasted" to all addons through this method, in the hopes that one of them will be able to handle it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public SkriptAddon()

    • Method Detail

      • getAddons

        public static java.util.List<SkriptAddon> getAddons()

      • handleTrigger

        public abstract void handleTrigger(Trigger trigger)
        When a Trigger is successfully parsed, it is "broadcasted" to all addons through this method, in the hopes that one of them will be able to handle it.
        Parameters:
        trigger - the trigger to be handled
        See Also:
        canHandleEvent(SkriptEvent)

      • finishedLoading

        public void finishedLoading()
        Is called when a script has finished loading. Optionally overridable.

      • canHandleEvent

        public final boolean canHandleEvent(SkriptEvent event)
        Checks to see whether the given event has been registered by this SkriptAddon ; a basic way to filter out triggers you aren't able to deal with in handleTrigger(Trigger). A simple example of application can be found in Skript.handleTrigger(Trigger).
        Parameters:
        event - the event to check
        Returns:
        whether the event can be handled by the addon or not
        See Also:
        Skript.handleTrigger(Trigger)
